data.title: Love it
data.text: Pad Thai!!!!!!!!!...and pineapple rice. And plenty of Curry and tofu options....That's all I have to say Trip Advisor, damn.

data.title: I love this cozy little restaurant - so good
data.text:
Had dinner here last week and just loved the cozy atmosphere of the place. It is so nostalgic of older times. The food is very good and the service was excellent.  Highly recommend the spring rolls. Chicken Massaman was a little bit too thin for my taste; would ask them to make it thicker next time.

FYI:  this restaurant does not serve alcohol but are completely OK with you bringing your own. We brought beer and they gladly served us glasses to drink it.   Will bring wine and our own glasses next time.

data.title: Didn't meet expectations
data.text: I kept hearing about how awesome Sala Thai was and read mostly great reviews, but I was disappointed with the reality.  The prices were great, but food was average, the serving size was small and the restaurant was poorly heated.  I probably won't go back and recommend Fareast Fuzion or Viet Taste instead.

data.title: really disappointed in the food - pad see ew boring, another dish had way too much fish sauce
data.text: Did take out. Really disappointed in the food. Boring and way too much fish sauce in one of the dishes.

data.title: Excellent value lunch special
data.text: The place to go when you want a great lunch special. Nob Hill neighborhood just parallel to Central Avenue with its own large parking lot. At $6.99-7.99 it's an excellent value with just-enough portion sizes (small cup of daily soup, mini-spring roll, main dish with either rice or noodles, small dessert or fruit). I had the pad prik king with shrimp. While there were only four shrimp, they were good-sized and very tasty, and that was fine by me. After all, it's a lunch special not an all-you-can eat joint. Friendly, efficient service. The Thai iced tea was good but not to my taste. The tapioca pudding had tapioca pearls that were a disconcerting green color but it tasted good. We were asked to request spiciness on a scale of 1-4. I went for 3 based on the server's contention that their high ranking, 4, wasn't off-the-scale spicy as in super spicy Thai. That being said, I thought it was too hot and I can do pretty spicy food. The spiciness didn't overpower the flavor of the food, though.

data.title: Excellent and inexpensive Thai food in Nob Hill
data.text: Great little local Thai restaurant. The lunch special is outstanding - your entree, soup, egg roll, and dessert, all for around $7.50. You get your choice of heat levels - 1 star for mild, 4 for incendiary. I usually get level 3. I think our son tries to single-handedly keep SalaThai in business - he eats there at least once a week. Highly recommended.

data.title: Sort of funky place. Good food.
data.text: My favorite Thai restaurant in ABQ. This is a sort of funky little place (aging and kind of mismatched art, etc.), for some reason EVERYTHING is coated with plastic. The servings are somewhat on the small size. Certain things here are very good. I really like the veggie egg rolls but not the meat ones or the more conventional Thai fresh rolls. Pad Thai (and related), curries are good. The tapioca dessert is very nice, and I don't think on the menu for some odd reason. The wait staff is friendly and helpful but a bit slow.

data.title: Between average and very good
data.text: Maybe it was what I ordered, yet the food was uninspired..,  Add to that the small portions and this place is teetering on the "should I go back?" ledge.

data.title: Authentic Thai
data.text: This is a Thai-owned establishment just north of the corner of Central and Carlisle. The portions are small, the service is slow, but the food is good. This is a place to go with good friends to talk and share food. Their green curry chicken is divine. The head chef is a grandmotherly figure. If you see her, be sure to smile, slightly bow your head, hold your hands up in a praying position and say Sa-wah-dee-kah. You will be rewarded with the largest most beautiful smile you've ever seen.

data.title: Fantastic food and service!
data.text: A new favorite Thai place on Albuquerque. So glad we found this off the beaten path gem in the desert.

data.title: Great find
data.text: Found this restaurant several years ago on a visit and enjoyed it.  Went back again this year and enjoyed it just as much.  Very good food and service, excellent value, and no problem with off street parking.  Food is not overly spiced.  Even my wife, who is sensitive to hot and spicey foods, loves the food here.  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Home made Thai food
data.text: My friend introduced me to this restaurant shortly after I moved to Albuquerque and this place has never disappointed me. The food is always excellent, fresh, affordable, and the staff is professional and friendly. The location is great and there's always parking, which makes it a lot easier and convenient in the Nob Hill area.

data.title: Excellent weekday lunches
data.text: My friends and I go about once a week for lunch during the work week.  All staff has always been very friendly and helpful.  Very nice portions for lunch and not expensive.  You can have the food as hot as you dare. Food made to order, so can order without egg in the noodles, etc.  I really enjoy eating here and would go on the week-ends if they had the luncheon special then.

data.title: Love Sala Thai
data.text: Just moved here in the month of May 2014 and have already visited Sala Thai 2 times. Once for dinner with family and once for lunch. This place is awesome! I've had thai in other cities and it's been pricey or kind weird tasting. Sala Thai is very reasonably priced, the staff is super nice, and the food is quite tasty. The location is easy to find and there is always adequate parking. This place was recommended to us by some local friends and they were not wrong about how good it is. I especially enjoy the lunches and the extra yummy food that is offered. Looks like I found a winner for thai food. Yum.

data.title: Nice hole in the wall
data.text: Great food, prices, friendly staff. Couldn't ask for more except possibly a beer and wine license. In very walkable Nob Hill.
